title: What is the original font of "Isabel"?
content:
This font is called “Isabel” on a certain website, but I can’t find it anywhere on the web for purchase or download. Anyone know an alternate name or similar font?

Thanks! Tom

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Isabel\_Sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515/http:/typophile.com/files/Isabel_Sample_0.jpg) | 32.92 KB |

 [‹ "Parla Con Me" Italian TV programme logo straight-sided tech sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515/http:/typophile.com/node/40111 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Peace, Health and Happiness" unicase serif face - Panoptica {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515/http:/typophile.com/node/39996 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tkisker

comments.content:
Hi Tom,

have you been through this list of [formal scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html), compiled by Mike Yanega?

<cite>or similar font?</cite>  
 [Bickham Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/bickham.html) is a well-done font in this style and, using some alternates, can be pretty close:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071219001515im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bickham_5921.png)
  
F
